name: The Anthropology of Violence and Suffering
description: This course examines the social life of violence, its cultural production and political effects in a global perspective. It asks how social worlds are made and unmade through, against, and after violent events, how violence is remembered and narrated, and how ethnography might respond to experiences of suffering, trauma, and victimhood.
prerequisites: ANTB19H3 and ANTB20H3 and at least 0.5 credit at the C-level in Socio-Cultural Anthropology.
